class.name: EditorInterface
class.description: [EditorInterface] gives you control over Godot editor's window. It allows customizing the window, saving and (re-)loading scenes, rendering mesh previews, inspecting and editing resources and objects, and provides access to [EditorSettings], [EditorFileSystem], [EditorResourcePreview], [ScriptEditor], the editor viewport, and information about scenes. [b]Note:[/b] This class shouldn't be instantiated directly. Instead, access the singleton directly by its name. [codeblocks] [gdscript] var editor_settings = EditorInterface.get_editor_settings() [/gdscript] [csharp] // In C# you can access it via the static Singleton property. EditorSettings settings = EditorInterface.Singleton.GetEditorSettings(); [/csharp] [/codeblocks]

method.name: edit_node
method.description: Edits the given [Node]. The node will be also selected if it's inside the scene tree.

method.name: edit_resource
method.description: Edits the given [Resource]. If the resource is a [Script] you can also edit it with [method edit_script] to specify the line and column position.

method.name: edit_script
method.description: Edits the given [Script]. The line and column on which to open the script can also be specified. The script will be open with the user-configured editor for the script's language which may be an external editor.

method.name: get_base_control
method.description: Returns the main container of Godot editor's window. For example, you can use it to retrieve the size of the container and place your controls accordingly. [b]Warning:[/b] Removing and freeing this node will render the editor useless and may cause a crash.

method.name: get_command_palette
method.description: Returns the editor's [EditorCommandPalette] instance. [b]Warning:[/b] Removing and freeing this node will render a part of the editor useless and may cause a crash.

method.name: get_current_directory
method.description: Returns the current directory being viewed in the [FileSystemDock]. If a file is selected, its base directory will be returned using [method String.get_base_dir] instead.

method.name: get_current_feature_profile
method.description: Returns the name of the currently activated feature profile. If the default profile is currently active, an empty string is returned instead. In order to get a reference to the [EditorFeatureProfile], you must load the feature profile using [method EditorFeatureProfile.load_from_file]. [b]Note:[/b] Feature profiles created via the user interface are loaded from the [code]feature_profiles[/code] directory, as a file with the [code].profile[/code] extension. The editor configuration folder can be found by using [method EditorPaths.get_config_dir].

method.name: get_current_path
method.description: Returns the current path being viewed in the [FileSystemDock].

method.name: get_edited_scene_root
method.description: Returns the edited (current) scene's root [Node].

method.name: get_editor_main_screen
method.description: Returns the editor control responsible for main screen plugins and tools. Use it with plugins that implement [method EditorPlugin._has_main_screen]. [b]Note:[/b] This node is a [VBoxContainer], which means that if you add a [Control] child to it, you need to set the child's [member Control.size_flags_vertical] to [constant Control.SIZE_EXPAND_FILL] to make it use the full available space. [b]Warning:[/b] Removing and freeing this node will render a part of the editor useless and may cause a crash.

method.name: get_editor_paths
method.description: Returns the [EditorPaths] singleton.

method.name: get_editor_scale
method.description: Returns the actual scale of the editor UI ([code]1.0[/code] being 100% scale). This can be used to adjust position and dimensions of the UI added by plugins. [b]Note:[/b] This value is set via the [code]interface/editor/display_scale[/code] and [code]interface/editor/custom_display_scale[/code] editor settings. Editor must be restarted for changes to be properly applied.

method.name: get_editor_settings
method.description: Returns the editor's [EditorSettings] instance.

method.name: get_editor_theme
method.description: Returns the editor's [Theme]. [b]Note:[/b] When creating custom editor UI, prefer accessing theme items directly from your GUI nodes using the [code]get_theme_*[/code] methods.

method.name: get_editor_undo_redo
method.description: Returns the editor's [EditorUndoRedoManager].

method.name: get_editor_viewport_2d
method.description: Returns the 2D editor [SubViewport]. It does not have a camera. Instead, the view transforms are done directly and can be accessed with [member Viewport.global_canvas_transform].

method.name: get_editor_viewport_3d
method.description: Returns the specified 3D editor [SubViewport], from [code]0[/code] to [code]3[/code]. The viewport can be used to access the active editor cameras with [method Viewport.get_camera_3d].

method.name: get_file_system_dock
method.description: Returns the editor's [FileSystemDock] instance. [b]Warning:[/b] Removing and freeing this node will render a part of the editor useless and may cause a crash.

method.name: get_inspector
method.description: Returns the editor's [EditorInspector] instance. [b]Warning:[/b] Removing and freeing this node will render a part of the editor useless and may cause a crash.

method.name: get_open_scenes
method.description: Returns an [Array] with the file paths of the currently opened scenes.

method.name: get_playing_scene
method.description: Returns the name of the scene that is being played. If no scene is currently being played, returns an empty string.

method.name: get_resource_filesystem
method.description: Returns the editor's [EditorFileSystem] instance.

method.name: get_resource_previewer
method.description: Returns the editor's [EditorResourcePreview] instance.

method.name: get_script_editor
method.description: Returns the editor's [ScriptEditor] instance. [b]Warning:[/b] Removing and freeing this node will render a part of the editor useless and may cause a crash.

method.name: get_selected_paths
method.description: Returns an array containing the paths of the currently selected files (and directories) in the [FileSystemDock].

method.name: get_selection
method.description: Returns the editor's [EditorSelection] instance.

method.name: inspect_object
method.description: Shows the given property on the given [param object] in the editor's Inspector dock. If [param inspector_only] is [code]true[/code], plugins will not attempt to edit [param object].

method.name: is_multi_window_enabled
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if multiple window support is enabled in the editor. Multiple window support is enabled if [i]all[/i] of these statements are true: - [member EditorSettings.interface/multi_window/enable] is [code]true[/code]. - [member EditorSettings.interface/editor/single_window_mode] is [code]false[/code]. - [member Viewport.gui_embed_subwindows] is [code]false[/code]. This is forced to [code]true[/code] on platforms that don't support multiple windows such as Web, or when the [code]--single-window[/code] [url=$DOCS_URL/tutorials/editor/command_line_tutorial.html]command line argument[/url] is used.

method.name: is_playing_scene
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if a scene is currently being played, [code]false[/code] otherwise. Paused scenes are considered as being played.

method.name: is_plugin_enabled
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the specified [param plugin] is enabled. The plugin name is the same as its directory name.

method.name: make_mesh_previews
method.description: Returns mesh previews rendered at the given size as an [Array] of [Texture2D]s.

method.name: mark_scene_as_unsaved
method.description: Marks the current scene tab as unsaved.

method.name: open_scene_from_path
method.description: Opens the scene at the given path.

method.name: play_current_scene
method.description: Plays the currently active scene.

method.name: play_custom_scene
method.description: Plays the scene specified by its filepath.

method.name: play_main_scene
method.description: Plays the main scene.

method.name: popup_dialog
method.description: Pops up the [param dialog] in the editor UI with [method Window.popup_exclusive]. The dialog must have no current parent, otherwise the method fails. See also [method Window.set_unparent_when_invisible].

method.name: popup_dialog_centered
method.description: Pops up the [param dialog] in the editor UI with [method Window.popup_exclusive_centered]. The dialog must have no current parent, otherwise the method fails. See also [method Window.set_unparent_when_invisible].

method.name: popup_dialog_centered_clamped
method.description: Pops up the [param dialog] in the editor UI with [method Window.popup_exclusive_centered_clamped]. The dialog must have no current parent, otherwise the method fails. See also [method Window.set_unparent_when_invisible].

method.name: popup_dialog_centered_ratio
method.description: Pops up the [param dialog] in the editor UI with [method Window.popup_exclusive_centered_ratio]. The dialog must have no current parent, otherwise the method fails. See also [method Window.set_unparent_when_invisible].

method.name: popup_node_selector
popup_property_selector
popup_quick_open
method.description: Pops up an editor dialog for quick selecting a resource file. The [param callback] must take a single argument of type [String] which will contain the path of the selected resource or be empty if the dialog is canceled. If [param base_types] is provided, the dialog will only show resources that match these types. Only types deriving from [Resource] are supported.

method.name: reload_scene_from_path
method.description: Reloads the scene at the given path.

method.name: restart_editor
method.description: Restarts the editor. This closes the editor and then opens the same project. If [param save] is [code]true[/code], the project will be saved before restarting.

method.name: save_all_scenes
method.description: Saves all opened scenes in the editor.

method.name: save_scene
method.description: Saves the currently active scene. Returns either [constant OK] or [constant ERR_CANT_CREATE].

method.name: save_scene_as
method.description: Saves the currently active scene as a file at [param path].

method.name: select_file
method.description: Selects the file, with the path provided by [param file], in the FileSystem dock.

method.name: set_current_feature_profile
method.description: Selects and activates the specified feature profile with the given [param profile_name]. Set [param profile_name] to an empty string to reset to the default feature profile. A feature profile can be created programmatically using the [EditorFeatureProfile] class. [b]Note:[/b] The feature profile that gets activated must be located in the [code]feature_profiles[/code] directory, as a file with the [code].profile[/code] extension. If a profile could not be found, an error occurs. The editor configuration folder can be found by using [method EditorPaths.get_config_dir].

method.name: set_main_screen_editor
method.description: Sets the editor's current main screen to the one specified in [param name]. [param name] must match the title of the tab in question exactly (e.g. [code]2D[/code], [code]3D[/code], [code skip-lint]Script[/code], or [code]AssetLib[/code] for default tabs).

method.name: set_plugin_enabled
method.description: Sets the enabled status of a plugin. The plugin name is the same as its directory name.

method.name: stop_playing_scene
method.description: Stops the scene that is currently playing.

members.member: If [code]true[/code], enables distraction-free mode which hides side docks to increase the space available for the main view.
If [code]true[/code], the Movie Maker mode is enabled in the editor. See [MovieWriter] for more information.
